result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Kyle A. Schaefer was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called: 1:52 pm 
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Suzanne O'Neill;
Atty Wetzsteon states findings and makes statement regarding case. 
Parties met in chambers prior to coming on the record. 
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
Ct. 3 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Use of a Dangeous Weapon)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
  
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (1st Degree Intentional Homicide-Attempt-Use of a Dangerous Weapon-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 2 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Use of a Dangerous Weapon-Domestic Abuse)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

Parties are stipulating that the Affirmative Defense of Not Guilty/Not Guilty due to mental disease or defect plea is present in this case.
COURT has reviewed the Examinations that have been submitted.
Court makes findings.
COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 1 (1st Degree Intentional Homicide-Attempt-Use of a Dangerous Weapon-Domestic Abuse)>> NOT GUILTY/NOT GUILTY DUE TO MENTAL DISEASE OR DEFECT.
Ct. 2 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Use of a Dangerous Weapon-Domestic Abuse)>> NOT GUILTY/NOT GUILTY DUE TO MENTAL DISEASE OR DEFECT.

Victim statements are read by Victim Witness Coordinator. 
State makes sentencing arguments.
Defense makes sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement.
COURT addresses the parties.

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (1st Degree Intentional Homicide-Attempt-Use of a Dangerous Weapon-Domestic Abuse)>> 45 Year Commitment. Court finds 838 days credit.

Ct. 2 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Use of a Dangerous Weapon-Domestic Abuse)>> 45 Year Commitment. Court finds 838 days credit.
